title: Minimal
code: get_mean_data(iris) #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width #>          <dbl>       <dbl>        <dbl>       <dbl> #> 1         5.84        3.06         3.76        1.20 get_mean_data(my_dataset) #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   height  mass birth_year #>    <dbl> <dbl>      <dbl> #> 1   177.  82.8       53.4

code: @Manual{,   title = {mytools.bruno2: Mytools Bruno},   author = {Bruno Carayon},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, }

title: Mytools Bruno
text: goal {mytools.bruno2} provide basic function quickly analyse structure basic statistical information dataset.

title: Mytools Bruno
text: can install development version mytools.bruno2 GitHub :

title: Mytools Bruno
text: Please use my_dataset: dummy dataset try diferent functions package. basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(mytools.bruno2) ## basic example code  ## get_info_data provides basic information (dimension and column names)of the dataset get_info_data(iris) #> $dimension #> [1] 150   5 #>  #> $names #> [1] "Sepal.Length" "Sepal.Width"  "Petal.Length" "Petal.Width"  "Species" get_info_data(my_dataset) #> $dimension #> [1] 35 14 #>  #> $names #>  [1] "name"       "height"     "mass"       "hair_color" "skin_color" #>  [6] "eye_color"  "birth_year" "sex"        "gender"     "homeworld"  #> [11] "species"    "films"      "vehicles"   "starships"  ## get_mean_ data provides the average of all numeric variables in the dataset get_mean_data(iris) #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width #>          <dbl>       <dbl>        <dbl>       <dbl> #> 1         5.84        3.06         3.76        1.20 get_mean_data(my_dataset) #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   height  mass birth_year #>    <dbl> <dbl>      <dbl> #> 1   177.  82.8       53.4

title: get_info_data — get_info_data
text: function provide following information data.frame: dimension column names.

title: get_info_data — get_info_data
text: list first element data.frame dimension second element name columns

title: get_mean_data — get_mean_data
text: get_mean_data get table average numeric variables data.frame parameter.

title: get_mean_data — get_mean_data
code: get_mean_data(iris) #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width #>          <dbl>       <dbl>        <dbl>       <dbl> #> 1         5.84        3.06         3.76        1.20 get_mean_data(my_dataset) #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   height  mass birth_year #>    <dbl> <dbl>      <dbl> #> 1   177.  82.8       53.4

title: my_dataset — my_dataset
text: starwars dplyr dataset restricted humans (column species).

title: my_dataset — my_dataset
text: data frame 35 rows 14 variables: name character height integer mass numeric hair_color character skin_color character eye_color character birth_year numeric sex character gender character homeworld character species character films list vehicles list starships list

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: lhs value magrittr placeholder. rhs function call using magrittr semantics.
